function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of GPS data for monitoring infected individuals may raise privacy concerns and potential misuse of personal data.","Impact":"Loss of privacy, data security breaches, and potential surveillance abuse.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data privacy regulations, obtain explicit consent for data collection, and anonymize personal data before processing.","Technologies":"Data encryption, anonymization techniques, and secure data storage.","People":"General public, individuals under surveillance, and those whose data is being collected.","Owner":"Government agencies, technology companies, and data protection authorities."},{"Description":"Use of AI and machine learning to monitor public spaces may lead to increased reliance on surveillance and raise ethical concerns about privacy and consent.","Impact":"Erosion of privacy, potential misuse of surveillance data, and public distrust of technology-based monitoring.","Mitigation":"Implement transparent and accountable AI systems, conduct active public engagement on surveillance practices, and enforce strict data protection laws.","Technologies":"Transparent AI algorithms, privacy-preserving machine learning techniques, and public engagement platforms.","People":"General public, individuals under surveillance, and data scientists developing AI surveillance systems.","Owner":"Government agencies, technology companies, and data protection authorities."},{"Description":"Challenges in implementing wireless signal-based human detection in public places may lead to ineffectiveness of the technology and reliance on alternative monitoring methods.","Impact":"Inability to accurately detect human presence, limited coverage of monitoring areas, and potential gaps in disease surveillance.","Mitigation":"Invest in research for more robust wireless signal-based human detection, collaborate with technology experts to optimize the deployment of the technology, and integrate wireless signal detection with other monitoring systems.","Technologies":"Advanced wireless signal processing, collaboration platforms for research and optimization, and integration interfaces for monitoring systems.","People":"Researchers in wireless signal processing, technology experts, and government agencies implementing disease surveillance.","Owner":"Research institutions, technology companies, and government agencies."}]}
